content.question: Nitrogen Fixation <math alttext="N 2 plus 3 H 2 reacts to produce 2 N H 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>2</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>H</mi></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></math> Nitrification <math alttext="2 N H 3 plus 3 O 2 reacts to produce, 2 N O 2 plus 2 H 2 O plus 2 H with a positive one charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext>N</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O+</mtext><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math> Denitrification <math alttext="2 N O 3 with a negative one charge plus 2 C H 2 O, plus 2 H with a positive one charge, reacts to produce N 2 O plus 2 C O 2 plus 3 H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>N</mtext><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msub></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext>CH</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>N</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mn>2</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>C</mtext><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mn>3</mn><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math> The table above shows the balanced chemical equations that represent three processes that are part of the nitrogen cycle. Which of the following is exemplified by the equations above?

choices.label: Approximately <math alttext="10%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>10</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> of energy is transferred from one trophic level to the next.
In a food web, energy flows and matter is cycled.
Each biogeochemical cycle demonstrates the conservation of matter.
The major reserve for nitrogen is in the atmosphere.

content.answer: Each biogeochemical cycle demonstrates the conservation of matter.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain environmental concepts and processes.
